messages.title: Glasgow is working with a conservative government
messages.content: A message about the City Deal which will see the UK Government have set up and investment for £1.13 billion, and other projects that have funded due to conservative teamwork at various levels.

messages.title: The only candidate in Glasgow South who won't do a deal with the SNP
messages.content: The content speaks about the candidate's commitment to not doing any deal with SNP and standing firm against their referendum plans.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservative aim is to create 2 million more jobs in the next 5 years. Ensuring every young person leaves school with a job, college/uni place or apprenticeship to secure the future.
Kyle Thornton pledges to vote to continue the policy of raising pensions by at least 2.5% every year, ensuring older people can retire in dignity.

Kyle Thornton talks about creating jobs and capping welfare to ensure that work will continue to mean a life on welfare. Additionally, raising the tax-free threshold to £12,500 to help people keep more of their own money.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In Glasgow South alone there are 9,000 more people in work and 43% less people looking for work.

issues.economy: Securing a better future for Scotland through economic recovery, detailing job creation and support for small businesses.
issues.governance: Opposition to the SNP and rejection of their independence referendum plans, which the candidate states they will not support in any deal.

leaflet.personalStatement: Kyle Thornton describes himself as local and accountable, looking to make the community a better place to live for everyone.

images.caption: Photo of candidate Kyle Thornton with a supporter
Photo of Kyle Thornton and an unidentified woman
